utterance.speaker: JOE
utterance.content: We just arrived. Yeah, kids okay on your end? Good. Yeah, yeah, he's VERY excited. Hey, hey, listen, I gotta go, okay. I'll call you tomorrow. Excuse me.

utterance.speaker: JOE
utterance.content: Get away. Get away.

utterance.speaker: FATHER
utterance.content: Sorry about that. Sorry.

utterance.speaker: JENNY
utterance.content: What's wrong with him?

utterance.speaker: JOE
utterance.content: Excuse us.

utterance.speaker: JOE
utterance.content: I oughta go back and kick the hell out of that guy.

utterance.speaker: JOE
utterance.content: She's old enough. She didn't have to scream like that.

utterance.speaker: KENNY
utterance.content: It's okay, Dad. It didn't bother me.

utterance.speaker: KENNY
utterance.content: For the first time, none of these people bothered me. I just think thirty-six more hours.

utterance.speaker: DARNELL
utterance.content: Thirty-six more hours. How do you figure that, Kenny?

utterance.speaker: KENNY
utterance.content: Tomorrow at this time, I'm scheduled for surgery. It's a ten hour procedure, throw two in it for prep, thirty-six until I'm just another face in the crowd.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Kenny has a frontonasal encephalocele. It's a midline deformity. He's here to undergo a facial bipartition.

utterance.speaker: DARNELL
utterance.content: And what does that mean?

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Well, we have five surgeons...

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: ... four nurses. He's going to require six units of blood.

utterance.speaker: DARNELL
utterance.content: Will it fix him?

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: It'll repair a lot...

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: of the damage done by the...

utterance.speaker: DARNELL
utterance.content: We need a sound bite. Would you say he'd be ready for the junior prom?

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Yeah, yeah, well, that's probably true.

utterance.speaker: DARNELL
utterance.content: No, I need you to say it.

utterance.speaker: CRANIO SURGEON
utterance.content: Dr. Chase?

utterance.speaker: ANESTHESIOLOGIST
utterance.content: We got an issue.

utterance.speaker: ANESTHESIOLOGIST
utterance.content: Heart rate's skyrocketing. It's over 180.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: He's in v-fib. Paddles.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Charge to 300. Turn that camera off.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Is this a reaction to anesthesia?

utterance.speaker: ANESTHESIOLOGIST
utterance.content: Haven't given it yet.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Clear! Crank to 360.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: I said 'Turn that damn camera off!' Clear!

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: A teen-aged boy with a cranio-facial deformity was about to undergo a reconstructive procedure when he had an unexplained cardiac arrest.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Good.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Good?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I mean... go on.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: We have the patient on a pacing wire. It's the only thing keeping his heart going.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Yeah, we know. We're doctors.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Right. I was just... it was just for them...

utterance.speaker: DARNELL
utterance.content: Just be yourself.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Until we are able to figure out exactly what is causing the heart block, the reconstructive surgery is on hold, obviously.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: That's yourself? Fascinating case. I will see you again after I have saved his life. Have a warm bath waiting.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You following me?

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Darnell will be trailing you throughout the case.

utterance.speaker: DARNELL
utterance.content: Pretend we're not here.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: If I do that, won't I bump into you?

utterance.speaker: DARNELL
utterance.content: We'll stay out of your way.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You know, it's a joke. See, I became a doctor because of the movie 'Patch Adams'. Uh, listen, do you want to get ahead of me, maybe back up, I don't know, low down, makes me look more powerful...

utterance.speaker: DARNELL
utterance.content: That's, that's perfect.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Yeah. Also my eyes look better in...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: ...rooms with summer colors.

utterance.speaker: DARNELL
utterance.content: You know what, it's black and white...

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: You think I LIKE the cameras? You think I want the whole world watching you check out my ass and question my wardrobe?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Would it be better if I checked out your wardrobe and questioned your ass?

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: A little part of me...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: There is no little part of you.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: ...thought that maybe you would see what great PR this could be for the hospital, and not make ME force YOU to act like a human being.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You using force on me is... intriguing. On the other hand, cameras make people act. Sometimes like human beings, sometimes just weird, sometimes they wear open-tipped bras.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: It's cold in here.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Less obvious point is that I need my team to be unafraid of the metaphorical fart.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: That production company is covering all the medical costs for this kid. So, either you let them continue filming... or the kid goes home with the same face.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Sorry about that. Private. She waxes her mustache once a month... sometimes gets some pretty gnarly ingrown hairs.

utterance.speaker: COLE
utterance.content: So, did he hire you flat out, or are you competing for one of the spots?

utterance.speaker: TERZI
utterance.content: I'm not sure what you mean by that.

utterance.speaker: VOLAKIS
utterance.content: She's not competing. She was hand-picked by House. She's safe, like Foreman, so that takes three spots down to one.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Where's Foreman?

utterance.speaker: COLE
utterance.content: He's in the bathroom.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Good. Come on, let's go for a walk.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Walks look good on camera. They give the illusion of the story moving forward.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: New patient.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Sixteen-year-old boy with second-degree...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: ...infranodal heart block, post-arrest.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: Any reports of light-headedness or syncope?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Certainly not light-headedness.

utterance.speaker: VOLAKIS
utterance.content: Why did you hire her?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Not in front of the company.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: Are we going to be on TV?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I'm making a music video. Come on, move faster, more energy.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: Why are you glad Foreman's not here?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Because... he would object to what I'm about to do.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Hey buddy! You stay in there. We'll be out here making sure he doesn't move again. Gah! FINALLY hear myself think. Our patient has...

utterance.speaker: VOLAKIS
utterance.content: Why did you hire her?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Because she has way more diagnostic experience than the other swimsuit models I was considering. Our patient has a frontonasal encephalocele with a midline cleft. Ew. Don't stare directly at it. So, what caused Big Head's heart to stop?

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: Simple. His big head. Increased intracranial pressure would cause heart block.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Wrong. Sixteen years they've been testing that insane noggin to death.

utterance.speaker: TERZI
utterance.content: What about a congenital heart defect? He has a midline anomaly on his head, makes sense he'd have a midline anomaly in his heart too.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: That sixteen years of testing didn't show?

utterance.speaker: VOLAKIS
utterance.content: Why did you bring her in so late? It's not fair. The rest of us...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Hey hey! You want fair, you picked the wrong job. The wrong profession. The wrong species. Forget the deformity. Treat the patient like he's any other really, really ugly kid.

utterance.speaker: COLE
utterance.content: Infection. Could be endocarditis.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: Well, since he doesn't have a prosthetic heart valve, I assume you're thinking he's an IV drug user?

utterance.speaker: COLE
utterance.content: House said assume he's normal. Dealers don't ask for ID and don't care what you look like.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Nice. You're right about the habit, you're wrong about the substance. Blackened skin under the nose equals frostbite from huffing Freon. Freon's toxic, damages the heart.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: Discoloration could be acanthosis nigricans. It's a common side effect of these deformities.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: There's also discoloration on the cheeks and forehead.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Do a nuclear study. If I'm right, you'll see scarring of the heart.

utterance.speaker: TERZI
utterance.content: I'm not part of some game, am I? I gave up a career because I thought this was a firm offer.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Yes. This is a real offer.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I think she might be an idiot.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Who?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: But she can't be an idiot. She's in the CIA, for God's sake.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: The Bay of Pigs was a daring triumph.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: She had good ideas in Langley.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: All your ideas.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: She was able to identify that they were good ideas.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Stab in the dark here. Is she pretty?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: She's new. She's nervous.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: She's a 'C' cup.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: She said one dumb thing in the differential.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: They ALL say dumb things in differentials.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: A 'D' cup? If she's no good, just fire her.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I can't! I just hired her. She left a career.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Wow!

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Either that's actual guilt, or I've GOT to see this woman.

utterance.speaker: JOE
utterance.content: My son is not 'huffing Freon'.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: Mr. Arnold, Dr. House is like a savant when it comes to diagnostics.

utterance.speaker: JOE
utterance.content: What's his genius theory? Because Kenny's not normal, he's doing drugs to deal with his pain?

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: Maybe a way to look at this is that you ARE normal.

utterance.speaker: JOE
utterance.content: And what's that supposed to mean?

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: You're like any other parent... who thinks HIS kid can't be doing drugs.

utterance.speaker: KENNY
utterance.content: Doing this because my dad thinks I'm on drugs?

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: I was doing drugs behind my parent's back at your age, and I had a lot less reason to be.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: Not that your life must be miserable.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: Not that I am suggesting you should be doing drugs.

utterance.speaker: KENNY
utterance.content: I'm homeschooled.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: Really? You're lucky. Going to school was boring.

utterance.speaker: KENNY
utterance.content: My dad took me out and it wasn't because it was 'boring'.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: I had a rough time in school too. Maybe not like you but, uh, well... I don't mean to compare our situations. Actually, I guess I am comparing our situations, but only to show you how yours is worse.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: You can edit that out, right? So I don't look like an idiot?

utterance.speaker: KENNY
utterance.content: Relax. Everyone acts like an idiot around me. Makes ya think it's not an act. Can I have something for my headache?

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: Yeah. Is that new?

utterance.speaker: KENNY
utterance.content: Sixteen years old. It has the same birthday I do.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: I'm gonna start the test now.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: Studies showed no signs of scarring in Kenny's heart.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: It wasn't drugs.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Well, then give me something better. What's causing heart block?

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: Could be toxoplasmosis. We should do an LP to test for infection.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: If it was toxoplasmosis, we'd've seen enlarged lymphs. And because you're not pretty enough to be an idiot, you must know that already. Which means you just said it because you want to do an LP for intracranial pressure.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: Because it IS intracranial pressure.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Wait. I'm not done. You thought I wouldn't catch on, which means either you think I'M an idiot, which is flattering, doing my hair differently, or ...

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: The kid's got headaches. He's been popping acetaminophen like peanuts...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: How could you POSSIBLY think that I was done? I prefaced that with an 'either'. It needs an 'or'. Or you ARE an idiot. Which is possible. I'm not great at judging men's looks.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: The OR?

utterance.speaker: DARNELL
utterance.content: And the MRI room.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Yes. Dr. House frequently conducts differential diagnosis in a variety of places. He feels that a... change in venue often leads to a change in thinking processes.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: I have to go take care of something else.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: Just let me do a CT scan, see if I'm right. The sooner we fix the problem, the sooner we can get to his reconstructive surgery.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Who cares if you're dead? It's how you look. Well, since you've given me nothing better, we're back to drugs.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: The one thing we're know it's not.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Decreased uptake on the membranous septum.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: Could be an artifact. We can redo it.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: But nothing's nothing. Do an EP study.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: EP study means we have to stop this kid's heart.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: I'll set it up.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: House!

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: You have a minute? .To redo some valves?

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: I'm gonna thread this catheter through different areas in your heart. And once I've found the right pathway, I'll apply some electrical energy.

utterance.speaker: KENNY
utterance.content: Will it stop my heart?

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: Sounds worse than it is. You'll be fine.

utterance.speaker: KENNY
utterance.content: It gonna hurt?

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: There'll be some discomfort. If you've done drugs, I understand. Being different's really hard.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: Kenny. Uhm, it's more important for you to get better than to worry about getting in trouble.

utterance.speaker: KENNY
utterance.content: If I did drugs, that could explain my heart problem?

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: It could.

utterance.speaker: KENNY
utterance.content: Then you could do the surgery to fix my face?

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: That's why we're here.

utterance.speaker: KENNY
utterance.content: You know how famous people, everywhere they go, people are watching them, staring? They never have a chance to just be. Ya know? And a lot of them turn to drugs. People stare at them because they're beautiful. But me, they just stare at....

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: You okay? I need to know what kind of drugs, Kenny... and how much.

utterance.speaker: KENNY
utterance.content: Uhm, coke, mostly. Lotta coke. And then uh, when I run out, I used to go to LSD. Or acid.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: Those are the same thing.

utterance.speaker: KENNY
utterance.content: They are?

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: You don't do drugs, do you?

utterance.speaker: KENNY
utterance.content: I drank from my dad's liquor cabinet...

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: We're not going to do this test.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: I need you to turn on your side.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: We need to intubate. I need some help in here!

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Too bad you guys are going for a theatrical release. Vomiting blood would have made a great act-out. Likely causes?

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: Mallory Weiss tear.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: No pallor. No melena. Why are you wearing a tie?

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: I always wear ties. I'm a doctor.

utterance.speaker: DARNELL
utterance.content: Please don't look at the camera.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: Sorry.

utterance.speaker: VOLAKIS
utterance.content: Nasal papilloma. Hemorrhage could have overwhelmed the heart.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Nice lipstick.

utterance.speaker: VOLAKIS
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Bad idea.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: The hemorrhage came after the block.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: House. Let them do their job.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Anybody here more interested in the medicine and a little less interested in the paparazzi?

utterance.speaker: TERZI
utterance.content: Upper GI bleed. Could be something he ate or drank. Maybe a peptic ulcer.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Good.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Except no abdominal pain, the patient hasn't lost his appetite, and the last I checked the gastrointestinal tract isn't connected to the heart.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Yeah. But other than that. Real good.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: Nasopharyngeal angiofibrosis.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I just said it wasn't a nasal tumor.

utterance.speaker: COLE
utterance.content: Stomach cancer. Tumor causes bleeding, body's reaction to the tumor causes paraneoplastic syndrome which leads to heart block.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Finally! Someone who is NOT just a pretty face. You and Taub, run the 'scope, find the tumor.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: Ah... could be dangerous. If the bleeding was caused by liver failure as a result of the intracranial pressure....

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Liver is the one organ you can't ascribe to intracranial pressure.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: True.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: Intracranial pressure CAN cause liver problems. It causes an increase in the cavernous sinus pressure, which causes pressure in the superior vena cava, which shuts down the liver.

utterance.speaker: COLE
utterance.content: Did you just think of that?

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: COLE
utterance.content: Then why didn't you say anything...?

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: Think he'd change his mind? Not a chance.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: House would have undercut me, forced me to do a procedure I'd just argued against...

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: ...and then I'd look like a hypocrite in front of the thousands of people and potential future employers watching this film.

utterance.speaker: COLE
utterance.content: If you're right and you stick a 'scope back down a kid with liver failure, he could bleed again.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: I know.

utterance.speaker: JOE
utterance.content: He just vomited blood. Isn't that dangerous?

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: Nope. You're in good hands.

utterance.speaker: JOE
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Well, it's great how he rebounded...

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: ... from that setback.

utterance.speaker: DARNELL
utterance.content: What setback?

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: He didn't tell you about the... well, it's his right. The records WERE sealed. Personally, I think he WAS just tapping his foot and reaching for the toilet paper. Obviously, it was a witch hunt.

utterance.speaker: DARNELL
utterance.content: You think they singled him out because...

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: No. Literally a witch hunt. Dr. House is a practicing Wiccan. It's a beautiful religion. It's very caring.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Hey, hey, hey hey! You have an all-access pass to the case, not my Fave Five. So go.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Come on, come on - let's go!

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I think I'm going blind.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Hairy palms, too?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: She said something idiotic again and I didn't even notice it. It took Foreman to point out that it was idiotic. She's making ME an idiot.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: That's cute. You have a crush.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: No, I think it's something systemic.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Thirteen's pretty. You're obviously okay with her.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: She killed a PATIENT.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: The bitch is pretty.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: The bitch is a bitch.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Ask her out.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: The bitch? She's a BITCH.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: No. The one that's making you an idiot. The story of life. Boy meets girl, boy gets stupid, boy and girl live stupidly ever after.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Pretty girl kill again?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Nope, Elephant Boy just vomiting up blood again.

utterance.speaker: COLE
utterance.content: No tumors in the patient's stomach. So...

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: The laparoscope caused variceal bleeding. Took twenty minutes of banding to stop it.

utterance.speaker: COLE
utterance.content: Taub was right about the liver failure.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: His cranio-facial deformity is causing intracranial pressure which is cau...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Nope. Where are the nosebleeds? Where's the labored bleeding? You were right about me being wrong. You're wrong about you being right. I need new ideas. Anybody.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Does it bother you...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: ...that this kid's gonna die because you won't put down that camera?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: At all? You know?

utterance.speaker: DARNELL
utterance.content: You people should be extra motivated. I'm sure they all want to look good in the film.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: No. Now they're too worried about looking BAD.

utterance.speaker: TERZI
utterance.content: Dr. House.

utterance.speaker: TERZI
utterance.content: Heart block plus liver failure could mean auto-immune. Maybe scleroderma.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Foreman? Does that make sense?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Not without tight skin on the hands, muscle weakness, and a thirty-year-old patient.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: Liver failure plus heart block could be a mitochondrial disorder.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Hey. Say what she just said.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: Liver failure plus heart block could be a mitochondrial disorder?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Go look for signs of retinal degeneration.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: No. It's ICP. You're only going to see swelling.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Take him with you, so he can see the degeneration too.

utterance.speaker: DARNELL
utterance.content: So, before you worked here in the ER, you worked for House, right?

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Three-and-a-half years.

utterance.speaker: DARNELL
utterance.content: Why did you leave?

utterance.speaker: MALE PATIENT
utterance.content: Hey. I don't want to be on TV. I'm not signing a release.

utterance.speaker: DARNELL
utterance.content: We'll blur you out.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Take off your pants.

utterance.speaker: MALE PATIENT
utterance.content: Will you be able to use any of this if I start swearing?

utterance.speaker: DARNELL
utterance.content: Did House treat you as badly as he treats his current fellows?

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Loaded question.

utterance.speaker: MALE PATIENT
utterance.content: Faaark. That's not even a word.

utterance.speaker: MALE PATIENT
utterance.content: Fork!

utterance.speaker: DARNELL
utterance.content: Very clever.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: I learned how to be a doctor from House. Or at least a doctor who learned how to be a doctor from House, if that makes any sense.

utterance.speaker: DARNELL
utterance.content: And you left his team because you couldn't stand him any more?

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: No... no. I... I love Dr. House.

utterance.speaker: DARNELL
utterance.content: Well that's something we haven't heard.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: I mean... what did you ask me again?

utterance.speaker: DARNELL
utterance.content: Why you left.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: I loved... being around him. Professionally. You know... he was always... stimulating. Not... in an erotic sense of the word.

utterance.speaker: MALE PATIENT
utterance.content: Fork! They forked. And then they spooned.

utterance.speaker: VOLAKIS
utterance.content: Lean forward and place your chin on the rest.

utterance.speaker: KENNY
utterance.content: I can't reach it.

utterance.speaker: VOLAKIS
utterance.content: Uh, scootch in a little.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: I'll take care of it.

utterance.speaker: JOE
utterance.content: Just like last time?

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: Maybe we should try this the old-fashioned way , hmmm?

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: 'k.... Look up at the ceiling. And try not to blink, okay?

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: Ok, good. Now straight ahead.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: There it is. Swelling. No degeneration.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: It's not mitochondrial. Swelling proves...

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: ... there's increased pressure in his brain.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Absolutely.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: So now we can reschedule the reconstruction.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Absolutely not.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: Your test proved you wrong. We found exactly what I predicted we'd find.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Swelling means there's increased pressure. You get a gold Star of David for proving that...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: ...yes, this kid has a big head and big heads cause pressure. Doesn't explain the liver.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: Too much acetaminophen does.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: JRA explains all of it, including the liver. One theory's better than two.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Treat with steroids.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: IF you're wrong...

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: ...steroids are going to mess with his immune system...

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: ...put off his surgery for months.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You really want to lose this argument in front of the camera?

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: I'll speak to the father.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: Dr. House believes that Kenny has JRA - Juvenile Rheumatoid Arthritis. And we need to start administering steroids.

utterance.speaker: JOE
utterance.content: Will the steroids fix it?

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: I don't think he has JRA.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: I think Dr. House is wrong, and that the steroid treatment could be dangerous. I think I can get House thrown off the case, and get Kenny the facial surgery he needs.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: The father refused steroids until we're sure about the diagnosis.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I AM sure. It's JRA.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: And why would he even doubt that, unless a FORMER fellow of mine was chirping in his ear.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: The decision was his. I merely voiced my concern.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Why did you take this job?

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: He's got a bulging cyst...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You had a perfectly good plastic surgery practice... lots of money.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: ...fluids aren't draining properly...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: The temptation to come screw with me just too much for you? There's got to be a better reason.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: He needs surgery.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Oh, and I think I mentioned this earlier - you're fired.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: What you did was over the line. Get out.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: But don't go anywhere. You're not fired. YET.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: No-one is firing anyone in the middle of this case. Not while those cameras are here, and not while Taub is the ONLY person that his father trusts.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Where are you going?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: To do what I always do in these situations.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Treat my patient behind his back.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: That's one option. Or you can do a CT scan of the kid's head. If there's no mid-line shift, we know Taub's wrong and you get your consent to give the kid steroids.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Just a warning. If we have to start getting consent every time we do a procedure, soon they'll be asking for INFORMED consent.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Didn't think you had the guts to stage a coup.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: Coup failed. I'm scheduled for execution at dawn.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: No, you're not.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: No reprieve from the governor.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: You're a test result away from becoming House's front-runner. He doesn't care about what you said or what you did five minutes ago. He just wants the next good idea. Show me twenty percent magnification of the forebrain.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: I look at our patient, as soon as I saw his face, I saw a regular kid.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: One thing about being a plastic surgeon - you don't see what is, you see what could be.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Talk like THAT around House, doesn't matter how many good ideas you come up with.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Uh... gosh. Uh... there's so many things.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Ah... is Dr. Taub available? Because he was very highly recommended....

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Do you know why he left?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Oh, my Goodness! Is he okay?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: 'cause... because my friend had his ears done by Dr. Taub. Should he worry that they may... pop back?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You know that toe... next to the big toe? Mine's bigger than my big toe. Is there any way to shorten it? Or make my big toe bigger? Like a toe-gmentation? Did he lie, cheat, or steal?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: What gave me away? Was it my obviously perfect feet?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Hi!

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: CT shows...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Let's go!

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: What are you two doing here?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Skipping three scenes. CT's back. He's gonna say that there's evidence of an anomaly, I'm gonna say he's wrong, he's gonna go back to the father, and we'll all end up here.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: Defect is pushing on the right frontal lobe. This bend is a sign of herniation.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Or it's a sign of increased pressure from JRA.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Dr. Taub would rather distract you from the truth...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: ... with sparkly things like four-carat diamonds.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: House.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Your partner said...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: ...that you left for personal reasons. But your wife said you lost a patient.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: You son-of-a-bitch. You spoke to my wife?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: See, that confused me.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Why would you give her a diamond if you screwed somebody else over? If you screwed HER over, I mean that could... I....

utterance.speaker: DOCTOR
utterance.content: Get that camera out of here!

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: You say anything to her?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Just asked questions.

utterance.speaker: FEMALE PATIENT
utterance.content: Get them out of here too!

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: We're doctors.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: I screwed around with a nurse. It became a deal. My partners found out... and I resigned. There. Happy?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: If you could be a bit more descriptive, I'd be happier.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: Some people pop pain pills. I cheat. We all have our vices.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Taub. I don't see it. Stay away from the family. House, start steroids and stay away from his family.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Wow! You are ugly.

utterance.speaker: KENNY
utterance.content: Wow. You're an ass. I have a deformity.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I know. That's why you're ugly.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: But you're a lucky boy. Anywhere else in the animal kingdom, your parents would have eaten you at birth.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Your son needs steroids.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Dr. Cuddy agrees.

utterance.speaker: JOE
utterance.content: Does Dr. Taub?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: He's not a real doctor. He's a plastic surgeon. All he cares is that your son looks good in his COFFIN.

utterance.speaker: JOE
utterance.content: So, I'm supposed to believe you. A doctor who cares.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You shouldn't care if I care.

utterance.speaker: JOE
utterance.content: I don't trust you.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Because... I don't think the surgery's important. You're putting your trust in someone who DOES think the surgery's important. You're willing to take chances, to risk your son's life for something he doesn't need?

utterance.speaker: KENNY
utterance.content: I DO need it!

utterance.speaker: KENNY
utterance.content: I can't have real relationships, I can't even have a real conversation. Not even with my Dad.

utterance.speaker: KENNY
utterance.content: Dad, I know you love me. But you don't treat me normal. You're always protective. The world can always go to hell. But you never yell at me, even when I screw up.

utterance.speaker: KENNY
utterance.content: I want to be normal.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: We're gonna get caught.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: But not on film. All their camera equipment's in here.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Where'd you get those keys?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Blue the janitor.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: That's his name.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: His name's LOU.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Owe him an apology.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Just watch twenty minutes of this stuff, tell me if I'm out of my mind.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Finally. We have video evidence.

utterance.speaker: TERZI
utterance.content: Dr. House. Heart block plus liver failure could mean autoimmune. Maybe scleroderma.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Foreman, does that make sense?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Not without tight skin on the hands, muscle weakness, and a thirty-year-old patient.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Can I see that again?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: What did you miss? She screwed up, I didn't...

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: No, just the part where she leans forward. I think you can see through her dress.

utterance.speaker: TERZI
utterance.content: Upper GI bleed. Could be from something he ate or drank. Maybe a peptic ulcer.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Good.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: You... thought... that was a good idea?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: What am I going to do?

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Just... enjoy.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I'm gonna to keep her around because she makes me an idiot?

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Well, you're protected. Foreman seems immune.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You think he's gay?

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Did he become an idiot around Chase?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I just said it's not a nasal tumor...

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Wait a minute. Rewind that. Was that Thirteen? Wow!

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I can't believe I'm that guy.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: EVERY guy is that guy.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I'm not every guy.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: What is this - semantics here? Okay... ALL guys are that guy.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I'm not all guys.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Cameron was smart.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: You know, I'm beginning to doubt that.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: I wanted to clarify something I said earlier. I love Dr. House. And then I qualified it. Which, after thinking about it, I didn't really need to do. I did love being around him. I guess... I just wanted to qualify what I qualified before. I'm looking defensive, aren't I?

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: No, no. I think that's great. It clears everything up.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: It's no big deal, really.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: There's a masked lesion in the left anterior temporal lobe surrounded by edema.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Did you just insult me in Pig Latin?

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: Dr. House. Please. Will you just take a look at this?

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: The defect is causing this nodular shadow here. You see?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You're right. I didn't see that before. Come on. Let's go!

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I know you think you're feeling better... on account of feeling better, but this trusted family doctor thinks that he's found a masked lesion, so if you could lie back down and struggle to breathe....

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: Okay. You were right.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: I'm thrilled I'm wrong. This is great, Kenny. You're gonna get your surgery now.

utterance.speaker: KENNY
utterance.content: First person I'm comin' back to see... is you. 'Cause compared to me, you're gonna look like butt.

utterance.speaker: JOE
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: KENNY
utterance.content: What? No comeback?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Look at that.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: His little finger. It's twitching.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: No... it's not.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Just give it a second.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: There.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: And?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: He's not better.

utterance.speaker: JOE
utterance.content: What's wrong?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: My diagnosis. I don't know what he has.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Cancel the surgery.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: New symptom. Involuntary muscle movement.

utterance.speaker: TERZI
utterance.content: Twitching finger is a symptom?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: The body doing something it's not supposed to do is the DEFINITION of a symptom.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: Kid's about to have a life-changing operation. He's nervous.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Or he's not.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Or you were right. Kid got better when we put him on steroids. This is JRA. And it's under control now.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Or the steroids have just tempered his condition.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You get a haircut, and still got bad hair.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: What about Lyme disease?

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: It explains everything - the heart issues, the internal bleeding, even why he'd get better on steroids.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: On the other hand, if he has Lyme Disease, there would be other subtle clues, like a huge, target-shaped rash. But thanks for playing.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: Why can't you just accept the fact you cured this kid?

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: You want to stop his surgery! You're not normal.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: So you don't want anybody else to be normal. You don't think normal's healthy.

utterance.speaker: VOLAKIS
utterance.content: Could be rheumatic fever. Also explains why the steroids helped - it's a similar inflammatory disease.

utterance.speaker: COLE
utterance.content: Rheumatic fever doesn't explain liver failure.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Taub thinks that acetaminophen does.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: Fine. Let's test your theory. Remove his pacing wire. If he's better, his heart'll beat just fine on its own, and then he can have his operation.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: If I'm right, his heart will stop. Kutner, keep the paddles on stand-by.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Another chance to blow someone up.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: There'll be some minor discomfort...

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: ...and you'll feel a slow, steady pulling sensation.

utterance.speaker: JOE
utterance.content: Are you SURE his heart is ready for this?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Absolutely.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: He's convinced he's sure. Whereas, I care about your son, and have therefore brought a professional defibrillist.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: We're not going to need those.

utterance.speaker: KENNY
utterance.content: Dad. I feel fine. My finger hasn't moved in a while.

utterance.speaker: JOE
utterance.content: Okay. Take 'im off.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: Here we go.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: Heart rate's 85 beats per minute.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: BP 110 over 70.

utterance.speaker: JOE
utterance.content: Is he okay?

utterance.speaker: KENNY
utterance.content: I feel the same.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: He's fine.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: You're fine.

utterance.speaker: JOE
utterance.content: Thank God.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: What you do mean, 'Thank God'?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: God's the guy who gave it to him.

utterance.speaker: JOE
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: JOE
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: DARNELL
utterance.content: Can you tell us about the procedure?

utterance.speaker: SURGEON
utterance.content: We have to use both an extra- and intra-cranial approach to get enough exposure to reduce the encephalocele cyst and do the bony reconstruction.

utterance.speaker: DARNELL
utterance.content: And how are you participating in the procedure?

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: She's not.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: They don't want me here because they think the kid's cured. I don't.

utterance.speaker: DARNELL
utterance.content: And what do you think the problem is?

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: Wish I knew. I just know that if Dr. House is right, something's gonna go wrong.

utterance.speaker: DARNELL
utterance.content: Dr. House doesn't think he's right.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: Well, then I'll just waste a few hours watching the surgery.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: See, the danger is...

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: ...we have to reconstruct all the way down to the cranial base...

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: ...and there are some big vessels down there. So what we'll do is work our way down to here...

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: When were these pictures taken?

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Well, about three weeks ago. Why? What do you see?

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: Well, the acanthosis nigricans was already there.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: It's... been there a lot longer than that. Probably his whole life.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: What about around his hairline?

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: What? There's no discoloration.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: There is now.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I have a new theory. Her bad ideas don't indicate a lack of intelligence, they indicate an open mind, the willingness not to be trapped by conventional....

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: You've got a problem.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Tell me something I don't know.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: You hire beautiful girls, enslave them...

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: ...force them to be around you because you don't know how to have an actual relationship. If they're qualified, keep them. If they're not, fire them... and ask them out.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You DO realize that 'tell me something I don't know' is just an expression.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Thirteen...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You think that just because she's as beautiful ... ergo...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: ...you think that because she hasn't had a decent idea....

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: No, my point is, she's about to enter your office, so you should shut up!

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: You were right about the diagnosis.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Yes. It was JRA. I'm very proud.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: No, I mean you were right about being wrong.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: He's got Lyme Disease. It explains everything.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Would you just hold up some fingers so I can see if I'm literally blind? We ruled out Lyme Disease HOURS ago.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: All the symptoms fit.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I am so ashamed. She really that good looking?

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Apparently.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: How many lives have been lost because of pretty girls?

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: The target rash is hiding!

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: No one ever looked at him closely enough.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: She's getting uglier by the second.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: We can try and pretend we're above it. We can try and intellectualize it away, but ultimately, shiny, pretty, perky things are good, and ugly, misshapen teenaged boys are repulsive.

utterance.speaker: DARNELL
utterance.content: The question was... do you resent Dr. Cuddy's interference in your practice?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Oh. Well, then, I guess my answer wasn't very helpful, was it?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Mini-stud. Stand up.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I spoke to your other partner.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: After Cuddy told you...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: No, I stayed away. Did it all over the phone. I asked for a reference, said you were applying for a plastic surgery job.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: Oh, God.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Yeah. He went nuts. Apparently you signed a non-compete. Now why would you agree to that?

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: I don't want to practice plastic surgery.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You sign a contract because someone's making you, someone's getting something from you. What did they give you in return?

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: They agreed to keep their mouths shut.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: So, you gave up your chosen career, just so they'd be quiet.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: I love my wife.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You risked this job. With nothing to fall back on.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: I thought you were wrong.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Sit back down.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: You're keeping him because he's a philanderer? Where do I sign up?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Ask the Mormon. I'm keeping him because he's interesting. Dr. Terzi, would you please stand up?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Nice. I have treated you unfairly. Prejudged you. And for me to be a better person, I have to rectify that situation. You're fired.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You... wanna grab some dinner?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Maybe a movie? Seriously.

utterance.speaker: DARNELL
utterance.content: Just days ago, with Kenny's condition worsening, it was Dr. Gregory House, reassuring Kenny and his father.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I care about your son.

utterance.speaker: DARNELL
utterance.content: The charming House, who happens to be a film buff with a soft spot in his heart for children, tells us how he got his start.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: See, I became a doctor because of the movie 'Patch Adams'.

utterance.speaker: DARNELL
utterance.content: Determined to save the boy's life, as well as keeping...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: The horror.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Well, it's nice of them to send us an early copy.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Not so much sent... as stolen.

utterance.speaker: DARNELL
utterance.content: In the end, it was Dr. Gregory House who served as not only a doctor, but a rock for Kenny and his father.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: ...You're putting your trust in somebody who DOES think the surgery's important.

utterance.speaker: DARNELL
utterance.content: House, one of those rare doctors who wears his heart on his sleeve...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: God!

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I was saying that was a STUPID thing to do.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: It's difficult not to be moved.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Oh, stop it! Suddenly, I don't feel I can trust Michael Moore movies.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Where you going? Kittens to get out of trees? Deaf kids to read to?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I owe it to the world to make sure this EVIL never sees the light of day.

utterance.speaker: DARNELL
utterance.content: Is there anything else?

utterance.speaker: KENNY
utterance.content: Thank you, Dr. House.
